greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Semiprimes in fifth spoke of a hexagonal spiral (A056109).
comment: a(1) = 6 because A056109(1) = 3*1^2 + 2*1 + 1 = 6 = 2 * 3 is semiprime. A056108(2) = 3*2^2 + 2*2 + 1 = 17 is not in the sequence, as it is a prime. a(2) = 34 because A056109(3) = 3*3^2 + 2*3 + 1 = 34 = 2 * 17 is semiprime. a(5) = 121 because A056109(6) = 3*6^2 + 2*6 + 1 = 121 = 11^2 is semiprime; the two prime factors need not be distinct. A056108(7) = 3*7^2 + 2*7 + 1 = 162 = 2 * 3^4 is not in the sequence, as it is a 5-almost prime. a(45) = 30201 because A056109(100) = 3*100^2 + 2*100 + 1 = 30201 = 3 * 10067 is semiprime.
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
xref: Semiprimes in other spokes: A113519, A113524, A113525, A113527, A113530.
results.author: _Jonathan Vos Post_, Jan 12 2006
